info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 6:25PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT EASTERN CLEARFIELD...NORTHWESTERN CENTRE...SOUTH CENTRAL CAMERON AND WEST CENTRAL CLINTON COUNTIES THROUGH 700 PM EDT... At 625 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 19 miles northeast of Clearfield to near Tyrone. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation possible. Locations impacted include... Philipsburg, Osceola Mills, Chester Hill, Karthaus, Houtzdale, North Philipsburg, South Philipsburg, Pine Glen, Morrisdale, West Decatur, Grassflat, Brisbin, Kylertown and Wallaceton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
